pageContext.description:
The panel is part of a Nativity scene. A group of putti kneel with Joseph beside the infant Christ's crib. Behind the shepherds have just arrived on the scene.
[Görres, cda 2015]
pageContext.dimensions:
Dimensions of support: 143.7 (l./r.) x 39.9 (t.) 40.1 (b.) cm
Dimensions of painted surface: 142 x ca. 38 (t.) 38.5 (b.) cm

[Technologische Untersuchung, Kunsthistorisches Museum, 2011]

involvedPersons.remarks:
Attributed to: a saxon artist
[Kunsthistorisches Museum, revised 2013]

'[...] stehen - eine nähere kritische Untersuchung vorbehalten - den Arbeiten Lucas Cranachs des Jüngeren nahe.'
[Gustav Glück, curator at the Gemäldegalerie, on 9.7.1907; Gemäldegalerie archive, KHM Z.252/1907]
involvedPersons.suffix: Circle of Lucas Cranach the Younger
Circle of Lucas Cranach the Elder

- bottom centre, on the vertical member:

[Kunsthistorisches Museum, revised 2013]

locations.path: Österreich > states > Wien > inhabited places > Wien

pageContext.medium:
Painting on spruce wood (Picea sp.)
The panel has been separated and laminated onto a second panel (probably lime wood) and cradled. The panel was originally the verso of a St Barbara (see
AT_KHM_GG6413r.)

[Kunsthistorisches Museum, revised 2013]

metadata.title: Right half of a Nativity Scene [right wing, exterior]

pageContext.provenance:
- first mentioned as part of the furnishings for the knights castle (Rittergruft)  built under Emperor Franz I. within the grounds of Laxenburg castle. 
[A. Ilg, 1973, S. 46]; [Leitner 1978, 23]

- 1907 brought to the conservation department of the Kunsthistorische Hofmuseum for restoration. 
[KHM, Gemäldegalerie archive, Galerieakten Z.252/1907]

- 1922 entered in the inventory of the Gemäldegalerie of the KHM 
[KHM, Gemäldegalerie archive , Galerieakten Z.18/1922]

[Kunsthistorisches Museum, revised 2013]
pageContext.relatedWorks: - together with AT_KHM_GG6413r and AT_KHM_GG6412 wing panels of an altar

titles.title: Right half of a Nativity Scene [right wing, exterior]
